ticket.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options
ticket.original-body:
Current ActiveModel Validators do not pass their options hash to Errors#add. This makes it hard for plugin authors to add arbitrary options to, e.g. a call like validates_presence_of :format => "some format".
Also, there's still that confusion of :default vs :message options that never could be cleaned up due to BC concerns since 2.2.x
I've tried to clean these things up and relax Validator message generation by passing their (filtered) options hash (i.e. options like :allow_nil will not be passed to the errors collection)
Here's the commit on my fork:
http://github.com/svenfuchs/rails/commit/e63e207bc12f3903e51e9c412f6ca28836188606
I'll also attach the commit formatted as a patch.
ticket.latest-body:
Current ActiveModel Validators do not pass their options hash to Errors#add. This makes it hard for plugin authors to add arbitrary options to, e.g. a call like validates_presence_of :format => "some format".
Also, there's still that confusion of :default vs :message options that never could be cleaned up due to BC concerns since 2.2.x
I've tried to clean these things up and relax Validator message generation by passing their (filtered) options hash (i.e. options like :allow_nil will not be passed to the errors collection)
Here's the commit on my fork:
http://github.com/svenfuchs/rails/commit/e63e207bc12f3903e51e9c412f6ca28836188606
I'll also attach the commit formatted as a patch.
ticket.original-body-html:
Current ActiveModel Validators do not pass their options hash to Errors#add. This makes it hard for plugin authors to add arbitrary options to, e.g. a call like validates_presence_of :format => "some format".

Also, there's still that confusion of :default vs :message options that never could be cleaned up due to BC concerns since 2.2.x

I've tried to clean these things up and relax Validator message generation by passing their (filtered) options hash (i.e. options like :allow_nil will not be passed to the errors collection)

Here's the commit on my fork:

http://github.com/svenfuchs/rails/commit/e63e207bc12f3903e51e9c412f...

I'll also attach the commit formatted as a patch.

version.body:
Current ActiveModel Validators do not pass their options hash to Errors#add. This makes it hard for plugin authors to add arbitrary options to, e.g. a call like validates_presence_of :format => "some format".
Also, there's still that confusion of :default vs :message options that never could be cleaned up due to BC concerns since 2.2.x
I've tried to clean these things up and relax Validator message generation by passing their (filtered) options hash (i.e. options like :allow_nil will not be passed to the errors collection)
Here's the commit on my fork:
http://github.com/svenfuchs/rails/commit/e63e207bc12f3903e51e9c412f6ca28836188606
I'll also attach the commit formatted as a patch.
version.body-html:
Current ActiveModel Validators do not pass their options hash to Errors#add. This makes it hard for plugin authors to add arbitrary options to, e.g. a call like validates_presence_of :format => "some format".

Also, there's still that confusion of :default vs :message options that never could be cleaned up due to BC concerns since 2.2.x

I've tried to clean these things up and relax Validator message generation by passing their (filtered) options hash (i.e. options like :allow_nil will not be passed to the errors collection)

Here's the commit on my fork:

http://github.com/svenfuchs/rails/commit/e63e207bc12f3903e51e9c412f...

I'll also attach the commit formatted as a patch.
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body: +1 This would definitely be helpful for plugin development
version.body-html: +1 This would definitely be helpful for plugin development
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body: Thanks Sven, good patch! However, I don't think it's necessary to filter the options. It adds extra complexity to the code and I cannot see any reason. Wdyt?
version.body-html: Thanks Sven, good patch! However, I don't think it's necessary to filter the options. It adds extra complexity to the code and I cannot see any reason. Wdyt?
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options
Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body: Can some bugmashers add some feedback as it relates to option filtering? If it's deemed unnecessary, can the patch be modified to remove the filtering?
version.body-html: Can some bugmashers add some feedback as it relates to option filtering? If it's deemed unnecessary, can the patch be modified to remove the filtering?
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body: This patch does not apply cleanly anymore. I will try to extract the parts that should apply and see if the filtering is needed.
version.body-html: This patch does not apply cleanly anymore. I will try to extract the parts that should apply and see if the filtering is needed.
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body:
I have adapted the patch so that it applies on master, some small cleanups here and there.
The filtering is currently needed, because the tests in i18n_generate_message_validation_test.rb have a very precise expectations of how methods are being called. Here is an example:
@@@ ruby def test_errors_add_on_empty_generates_message @person.errors.expects(:generate_message).with(:title, :empty, {}) @person.errors.add_on_empty :title end @@@
I would like to make that more flexible so the code can be more flexible. This code already gives a lot more flexibility.
I have ran all tests for activemodel and activerecord. I have added Sven Fuchs to the authors.
version.body-html:
I have adapted the patch so that it applies on master, some small cleanups here and there.

The filtering is currently needed, because the tests in i18n_generate_message_validation_test.rb have a very precise expectations of how methods are being called. Here is an example:

  def test_errors_add_on_empty_generates_message
    @person.errors.expects(:generate_message).with(:title, :empty, {})
    @person.errors.add_on_empty :title
  end

I would like to make that more flexible so the code can be more flexible. This code already gives a lot more flexibility.

I have ran all tests for activemodel and activerecord. I have added Sven Fuchs to the authors.
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body: I forgot the patch...
version.body-html: I forgot the patch...
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body:
+1 verified
All tests pass on master.
Here's the patch without whitespace errors. Preserves authorship.
version.body-html:
+1 verified

All tests pass on master.

Here's the patch without whitespace errors. Preserves authorship.
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body:
(from [bc1c8d58ec45593acba614d1d0fecb49adef08ff]) Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their (filtered) options.
This makes it possible to pass additional options through Validators to message generation. E.g. plugin authors want to add validates_presence_of :foo, :format => "some format".
Also, cleanup the :default vs :message options confusion in ActiveModel validation message generation.
Also, deprecate ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank(attributes, custom_message) in favor of ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank(attributes, options).
Original patch by Sven Fuchs, some minor changes and has been changed to be applicable to master again
[#4057 state:committed]
Signed-off-by: Jeremy Kemper <jeremy@bitsweat.net> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/bc1c8d58ec45593acba614d1d0fecb49adef08ff
version.body-html:
(from [bc1c8d58ec45593acba614d1d0fecb49adef08ff]) Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their (filtered) options.

This makes it possible to pass additional options through Validators to message
generation. E.g. plugin authors want to add validates_presence_of :foo, :format
=> "some format".

Also, cleanup the :default vs :message options confusion in ActiveModel
validation message generation.

Also, deprecate ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank(attributes, custom_message) in
favor of ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank(attributes, options).

Original patch by Sven Fuchs, some minor changes and has been changed to be applicable to master again

[#4057 state:committed]

Signed-off-by: Jeremy Kemper jeremy@bitsweat.net
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/bc1c8d58ec45593acba614d1d0fecb...

Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body: Sorry, but I had to revert. Please check the comments in d6cbb27e7b260c970bf7 ( http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/d6cbb27e7b260c970bf7d07dc0b0591ed82cee2a ).

version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options
Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body:
The goal of the commit was to make the validations more flexible. The whitelist approach was an intermediate solution to satisfy the strict tests. My plan was to see how I could make the tests more flexible to make the code more flexible and have the whitelist removed. I thought that would be easier when the whitelist was in one spot.
Anyhow, I think I know how to approach this problem better now. I'll work on a new patch.
version.body-html:
The goal of the commit was to make the validations more flexible. The whitelist approach was an intermediate solution to satisfy the strict tests. My plan was to see how I could make the tests more flexible to make the code more flexible and have the whitelist removed. I thought that would be easier when the whitelist was in one spot.

Anyhow, I think I know how to approach this problem better now. I'll work on a new patch.
version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.title: Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options
Make ActiveModel::Errors#add_on_blank and #add_on_empty accept an options hash and make various Validators pass their options

version.body:
Here is my latest patch. I have done a lot of refactoring in the tests to make sure things aren't repeated all over the place.
Each validators cleans it on own options now. The Errors object only filters :if, :unless and :on.
version.body-html:
Here is my latest patch. I have done a lot of refactoring in the tests to make sure things aren't repeated all over the place.

Each validators cleans it on own options now. The Errors object only filters :if, :unless and :on.
